p: Pathological studies: Heart, kidney, liver, lungs, stomach, small intestine, and spleen were the major organs that were removed from the animals for histopathological studies at the end point of the study. The tissues were fixed in 10% buffered formalin and dehydrated in graded series of alcohol, cleared in xylene, and embedded in paraffin wax. Multiple sections from each block were prepared at a thickness of 5 Î¼m and stained with hematoxylin and eosin (H&E) for histopathological studies.
